articles.title: Light in the sky caused by star 'squeezed' by black hole - BBC
articles.description: A bright light show in February 2022 was caused by a star being sucked into a black hole.
articles.content:
An "extraordinary flash" seen in the sky earlier this year was caused by a distant star being "squeezed like a toothpaste tube" by a supermassive black hole, astronomers have said.
